Property.preferredDefinition: A fluid used to fill the space between a microscope's objective lens and the coverslip. It is used to increase the effective numerical aperture of the lens.

Concepts.definition: A fluid used to fill the space between a microscope's objective lens and the coverslip. It is used to increase the effective numerical aperture of the lens.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.

Concepts.definition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A trihydroxyalcohol with localized osmotic diuretic and laxative effects. Glycerin elevates the blood plasma osmolality thereby extracting water from tissues into interstitial fluid and plasma. This agent also prevents water reabsorption in the proximal tubule in the kidney leading to an increase in water and sodium excretion and a reduction in blood volume. Administered rectally, glycerin exerts a hyperosmotic laxative effect by attracting water into the rectum, thereby relieving constipation. In addition, glycerin is used as a solvent, humectant and vehicle in various pharmaceutical preparations.

Concepts.definition: A trihydroxyalcohol with localized osmotic diuretic and laxative effects. Glycerin elevates the blood plasma osmolality thereby extracting water from tissues into interstitial fluid and plasma. This agent also prevents water reabsorption in the proximal tubule in the kidney leading to an increase in water and sodium excretion and a reduction in blood volume. Administered rectally, glycerin exerts a hyperosmotic laxative effect by attracting water into the rectum, thereby relieving constipation. In addition, glycerin is used as a solvent, humectant and vehicle in various pharmaceutical preparations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mixture of gases making up the earth's atmosphere, consisting mainly of nitrogen, oxygen, argon, and carbon dioxide.

Concepts.definition: A mixture of gases making up the earth's atmosphere, consisting mainly of nitrogen, oxygen, argon, and carbon dioxide.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: H2O, a clear, colorless, odorless, tasteless liquid that freezes into ice below 0 degrees centigrade and boils above 100 degrees centigrade.

Concepts.definition: H2O, a clear, colorless, odorless, tasteless liquid that freezes into ice below 0 degrees centigrade and boils above 100 degrees centigrade.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of numerous unctuous combustible substances that are liquid or can be liquefied easily on warming, are soluble in ether but not in water, and leave a greasy stain on paper or cloth.

Concepts.definition: Any of numerous unctuous combustible substances that are liquid or can be liquefied easily on warming, are soluble in ether but not in water, and leave a greasy stain on paper or cloth.
